topics.body:
"@twistedmetalero":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53379d506368722bd3d80000#post_53379d506368722bd3d80000
I wouldn't mind being a third wheel.
There's very little things I want and they don't have to do with anything about my own self.
I don't care if someone does something better than me at something or they can do it faster.


Easy nonmaterialism is the realization that physical wealth and collection of materialistic possessions has no real impact on one's happiness or who they are in life.  It's not whether or not you have anything, but what you use it for.  At the end of the day materialistic possessions and money are just tools.  Tools are meant to be used.  You can be the wealthiest person on the planet and if you don't use the tools given to you to in some manner bring back something to people then you're a drain on the economy.  Amassing wealth is nothing more than a drain on the economy and if you do that you're just a drain on society no matter the amount of money or possessions you acquire.  If anything having wealth makes you a leech to everyone else cause there are far better uses for wealth than just collecting things.

Tl:dr; it's called removing one's self from the situation.


Acquiring wealth no matter what and through any means is like the guy that steals everyone's lunches at work.
